00051 // Uncomment this to use Boost.Move, which can improve the speed when using
00052 // extremely large numbers. Note that using options::copy_on_write gives a much
00053 // more noticeable speed improvement.
00054 //#define BOOST_XINT_USE_MOVE
00055 
00056 #ifdef BOOST_XINT_USE_MOVE
00057     #include <boost/move/move.hpp>
00058     #define BOOST_XINT_COPY_ASSIGN_REF(type) BOOST_COPY_ASSIGN_REF(type)
00059     #define BOOST_XINT_COPYABLE_AND_MOVABLE(type) BOOST_COPYABLE_AND_MOVABLE(type)
00060     #define BOOST_XINT_RV_REF(type) BOOST_RV_REF(type)
00061     #define BOOST_XINT_MOVE(value) boost::move(value)
00062     #define BOOST_XINT_FORWARD(type, value) boost::forward<type>(value)
00063 #else
00064     template <typename T> class disable_boost_rv_ref: public T { };
00065     #define BOOST_XINT_COPY_ASSIGN_REF(type) const type&
00066     #define BOOST_XINT_COPYABLE_AND_MOVABLE(type)
00067     #define BOOST_XINT_RV_REF(type) disable_boost_rv_ref<type>
00068     #define BOOST_XINT_MOVE(value) value
00069     #define BOOST_XINT_FORWARD(type, value) value
00070 #endif

00082 typedef std::vector<unsigned char> binary_t;

00086 const std::size_t autobase = (std::numeric_limits<size_t>::max)();
00087 
00089 typedef std::size_t bitsize_t;
00090 
00092 template <class T>
00093 class base_divide_t {
00094     public:
00095     base_divide_t() { }
00096     base_divide_t(const T& q, const T& r): quotient(q), remainder(r) { }
00097     base_divide_t(const base_divide_t<T>& copy):
00098         quotient(copy.quotient), remainder(copy.remainder) { }
00099     base_divide_t(BOOST_XINT_RV_REF(base_divide_t) move) {
00100         quotient._swap(move.quotient); remainder._swap(move.remainder); }
00101 
00102     base_divide_t& operator=(BOOST_XINT_COPY_ASSIGN_REF(base_divide_t) copy)
00103         { quotient = copy.quotient; remainder = copy.remainder; return *this; }
00104     base_divide_t& operator=(BOOST_XINT_RV_REF(base_divide_t) move) {
00105         using std::swap;
00106         swap(quotient, move.quotient);
00107         swap(remainder, move.remainder);
00108         return *this; }
00109 
00110     T quotient, remainder;
00111 
00112     private:
00113     BOOST_XINT_COPYABLE_AND_MOVABLE(base_divide_t)
00114 };

00116 namespace detail {
00118 
00124 typedef boost::uintmax_t doubledigit_t;
00125 
00131 typedef boost::uint_t<std::numeric_limits<doubledigit_t>::digits / 2>::fast
00132     digit_t;
00133 
00136 const std::size_t        minimum_digits    = 1;
00137 const std::size_t        bits_per_digit    =
00138     std::numeric_limits<digit_t>::digits;
00139 const std::size_t        digits_in_uintmax =
00140     (std::numeric_limits<boost::uintmax_t>::digits + bits_per_digit - 1) /
00141     bits_per_digit;
00142 const digit_t       digit_hibit       = (digit_t(1) << (bits_per_digit-1));
00143 const doubledigit_t doubledigit_hibit = (doubledigit_t(1) << (bits_per_digit*2-1));
00144 const doubledigit_t digit_overflowbit = (doubledigit_t(1) << bits_per_digit);
00145 const digit_t       digit_mask        = digit_t(digit_overflowbit-1);
00147 
00149 
00152 struct magnitude_t {
00153     private:
00154     std::size_t copy_count;
00155 
00156     public:
00157     const bool readonly;
00158     const std::size_t max_length;
00159     digit_t digits[minimum_digits]; // Must be last data item, see "struct hack"
00160 
00161     magnitude_t(std::size_t max_len = minimum_digits, bool ro = false):
00162         copy_count(0), readonly(ro), max_length(max_len) { }
00163     magnitude_t(std::size_t max_len, bool ro, digit_t init): copy_count(0),
00164         readonly(ro), max_length(max_len) { digits[0] = init; }
00165     std::size_t copies() const { return copy_count; }
00166 
00167     void inc() { ++copy_count; }
00168     bool dec() { return (--copy_count == 0); }
00169 };
00170 
00171 inline std::size_t bits_to_digits(std::size_t bits) { return (bits +
00172     bits_per_digit - 1) / bits_per_digit; }
